us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class Torus3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.Shape3D<Torus3D>
      • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.Torus3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<Torus3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<Torus3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<Torus3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<Torus3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable

    public class Torus3D
extends Shape3D<Torus3D>
    Torus3D represents a torus in the XY-plane.

    Shape description:

    • The origin is located at the centroid or center of the torus.
    • The axis of revolution is the z-axis.
    • The torus is defined by two radii: tubeRadius that represents the radius of the tube, and radius that is the radius for the center of the torus to the center of the tube.

        public Torus3D(double radius,

        Parameters:
        radius - radius from the torus center to the tube center.
        tubeRadius - radius of the torus' tube.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tubeRadius is less than 1.0E-4 or if the resulting inner radius is less than 1.0E-4.

      • epsilonEquals

        public boolean epsilonEquals(Torus3D other,
                             double epsilon)
        Tests separately and on a per component basis if the pose and the radii of this torus and other's pose and radii are equal to an epsilon.
        Parameters:
        other - the other torus which pose and radii is to be compared against this torus pose and radii. Not modified.
        epsilon - tolerance to use when comparing each component.
        Returns:
        true if the two tori are equal component-wise, false otherwise.

      • isInsideEpsilonShapeFrame

        protected boolean isInsideEpsilonShapeFrame(double x,
                                            double y,
                                            double z,
                                            double epsilon)
        Tests if the query is located inside this shape given the tolerance epsilon.

        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this shape is increased by shifting its surface/faces by a distance of epsilon toward the outside.
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this shape is reduced by shifting its surface/faces by a distance of epsilon toward the inside.

        Specified by:
        isInsideEpsilonShapeFrame in class Shape3D<Torus3D>
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        y - the y-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        z - the z-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use for this test.
        Returns:
        true if the query is considered to be inside this shape, false otherwise.

      • evaluateQuery

        protected double evaluateQuery(double x,
                               double y,
                               double z,
                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics closestPointToPack,
                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Vector3DBasics normalToPack)
        Internal generic method used for the public API of any Shape3d.
        Specified by:
        evaluateQuery in class Shape3D<Torus3D>
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        y - the y-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        z - the z-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        closestPointToPack - closest point to the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape. Modified. Can be null.
        normalToPack - normal of the shape surface at the closest point. Modified. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the distance from the query to the closest point on the shape surface. The returned value is expected to be negative when the query is inside the shape.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(Torus3D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this and other to determine if the two tori are geometrically similar.

        This method accounts for the multiple combinations of radii and rotations that generate identical tori. For instance, two tori that are identical but one is rotated around its main axis are considered geometrically equal.

        Parameters:
        other - the torus to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two tori represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
